Line 263: Line 263:
*{{cite web|title= Donald Trump Birther|url= http://blog.cagle.com/2011/04/donald-trump-birther/ |last=Cagle |first=Daryl |work=The Cagle Post, [[MSNBC.com]] |date=April 9, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}
*{{cite web|title= Donald Trump Birther|url= http://blog.cagle.com/2011/04/donald-trump-birther/ |last=Cagle |first=Daryl |work=The Cagle Post, [[MSNBC.com]] |date=April 9, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}
*{{cite web|title= OK State Senator creates jobs|url= http://editorialcartoonists.com/cartoon/display.cfm/97413/ |last=Plante |first=Bruce |work=Tulsa World |date=March 31, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}</ref> On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth). According to both the Hawaii state government website and a June 6, 2009 article in the Honolulu Star-Bulletin, the computer-generated Certification of Live Birth is the only kind of birth record now issued by the state (original records are stored electronically), so the distinction between "short-form" and "long-form" is moot. When a citizen of Hawaii requests a certified copy of his or her birth certificate from the state, a Certification of Live Birth â what people are calling the "short-form," and what Obama released to the public in 2008 â is what they get. According to Hawaii Health Department spokesperson Janice Okubo, a COLB contains "all the information needed by all federal government agencies for transactions requiring a birth certificate." <ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref> On April 22, 2011, The Politico had speculated: "Hawaii law prevents the long-form record from being photocopied or released to anyone â including Obama. Obama himself would only be permitted to inspect it â not copy it or post it online." <ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they did. He provided it to the press on April 27. An image of the birth certificate, which confirms all of the details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref>
*{{cite web|title= OK State Senator creates jobs|url= http://editorialcartoonists.com/cartoon/display.cfm/97413/ |last=Plante |first=Bruce |work=Tulsa World |date=March 31, 2011 |accessdate=April 15, 2011}}</ref> On April 25, 2011 on Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN), Trump said he wanted President Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth). According to both the Hawaii state government website and a June 6, 2009 article in the Honolulu Star-Bulletin, the computer-generated Certification of Live Birth is the only kind of birth record now issued by the state (original records are stored electronically), so the distinction between "short-form" and "long-form" is moot. When a citizen of Hawaii requests a certified copy of his or her birth certificate from the state, a Certification of Live Birth â what people are calling the "short-form," and what Obama released to the public in 2008 â is what they get. According to Hawaii Health Department spokesperson Janice Okubo, a COLB contains "all the information needed by all federal government agencies for transactions requiring a birth certificate." <ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref> On April 22, 2011, The Politico had speculated: "Hawaii law prevents the long-form record from being photocopied or released to anyone â including Obama. Obama himself would only be permitted to inspect it â not copy it or post it online." <ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> However, on April 22, 2011, Obama requested that the Hawaii Board of Health release a certified copy of his long-form birth certificate to him which they did. He provided it to the press on April 27. An image of the birth certificate, which confirms all of the details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf]</ref>
  +   +
In the wake of Trump's statements about US President Obama, NBC and The Apprentice have been criticized for its involvement with Trump. There have been public calls for NBC to fire Trump from his role on The Apprentice-- most notably from sister-network host Lawrence O'Donnell and from US Congressman Anthony Weiner. <ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref>
